result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheterra D Bohanon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions (including child care).  Sentence credit of 4 days were granted if revoked.
May be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.   Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation within 48 hours.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with BP Gas Station located at N86 W16317 Appleton Avenue, Menomonee Falls.
DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins in court.   Defendant Sheterra D Bohanon did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant called the Clerk's office and is having car trouble and unable to appear.  The Court will recall the matter at 3:00 p.m. to allow for the Defendant to appear.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with BP gas station/any witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant not to discuss the case with the co-defendant.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Defendant Sheterra D Bohanon in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins in court.   Defendant Sheterra D Bohanon did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court revokes/forfeits bail.  Court issues capias, cashbail in the amount of $300.00.

Defendant to have no contact with BP gas station/any witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant not to discuss the case with the co-defendant.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Sheterra D Bohanon in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
